segment.source: Audit Distribution Group Management (Windows 10)
segment.target: Audit Distribution Group Management (Windows 10)

segment.source: This topic for the IT professional describes the Advanced Security Audit policy setting, Audit Distribution Group Management, which determines whether the operating system generates audit events for specific distribution-group management tasks.
segment.target: This topic for the IT professional describes the Advanced Security Audit policy setting, Audit Distribution Group Management, which determines whether the operating system generates audit events for specific distribution-group management tasks.

segment.source: Audit Distribution Group Management
segment.target: Audit Distribution Group Management

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows Server 2016
segment.target: Windows Server 2016

segment.source: Audit Distribution Group Management determines whether the operating system generates audit events for specific distribution-group management tasks.
segment.target: Audit Distribution Group Management determines whether the operating system generates audit events for specific distribution-group management tasks.

segment.source: This subcategory generates events only on domain controllers.
segment.target: This subcategory generates events only on domain controllers.

segment.source: Event volume: Low on domain controllers.
segment.target: Event volume: Low on domain controllers.

segment.source: This subcategory allows you to audit events generated by changes to distribution groups such as the following:
segment.target: This subcategory allows you to audit events generated by changes to distribution groups such as the following:

segment.source: Distribution group is created, changed, or deleted.
segment.target: Distribution group is created, changed, or deleted.

segment.source: Member is added or removed from a distribution group.
segment.target: Member is added or removed from a distribution group.

segment.source: If you need to monitor for group type changes, you need to monitor for “4764: A group’s type was changed.”
segment.target: If you need to monitor for group type changes, you need to monitor for “4764: A group’s type was changed.”

segment.source: “Audit Security Group Management” subcategory success auditing must be enabled.
segment.target: “Audit Security Group Management” subcategory success auditing must be enabled.

segment.source: Computer Type
segment.target: Computer Type

segment.source: General Success
segment.target: General Success

segment.source: General Failure
segment.target: General Failure

segment.source: Stronger Success
segment.target: Stronger Success

segment.source: Stronger Failure
segment.target: Stronger Failure

segment.source: Comments
segment.target: Comments

segment.source: Domain Controller
segment.target: Domain Controller

segment.source: IF
segment.target: IF

segment.source: No
segment.target: No

segment.source: IF
segment.target: IF

segment.source: No
segment.target: No

segment.source: IF - Typically actions related to distribution groups have low security relevance, much more important to monitor Security Group changes.
segment.target: IF - Typically actions related to distribution groups have low security relevance, much more important to monitor Security Group changes.

segment.source: But if you want to monitor for critical distribution groups changes, such as member was added to internal critical distribution group (executives, administrative group, for example), you need to enable this subcategory for Success auditing.
segment.target: But if you want to monitor for critical distribution groups changes, such as member was added to internal critical distribution group (executives, administrative group, for example), you need to enable this subcategory for Success auditing.

segment.source: Typically volume of these events is low on domain controllers.
segment.target: Typically volume of these events is low on domain controllers.

segment.source: This subcategory doesn’t have Failure events, so there is no recommendation to enable Failure auditing for this subcategory.
segment.target: This subcategory doesn’t have Failure events, so there is no recommendation to enable Failure auditing for this subcategory.

segment.source: Member Server
segment.target: Member Server

segment.source: No
segment.target: No

segment.source: No
segment.target: No

segment.source: No
segment.target: No

segment.source: No
segment.target: No

segment.source: This subcategory generates events only on domain controllers.
segment.target: This subcategory generates events only on domain controllers.

segment.source: Workstation
segment.target: Workstation

segment.source: No
segment.target: No

segment.source: No
segment.target: No

segment.source: No
segment.target: No

segment.source: No
segment.target: No

segment.source: This subcategory generates events only on domain controllers.
segment.target: This subcategory generates events only on domain controllers.

segment.source: Events List:
segment.target: Events List:

segment.source: 4749(S): A security-disabled global group was created.
segment.target: 4749(S): A security-disabled global group was created.

segment.source: 4750(S): A security-disabled global group was changed.
segment.target: 4750(S): A security-disabled global group was changed.

segment.source: 4751(S): A member was added to a security-disabled global group.
segment.target: 4751(S): A member was added to a security-disabled global group.

segment.source: 4752(S): A member was removed from a security-disabled global group.
segment.target: 4752(S): A member was removed from a security-disabled global group.

segment.source: 4753(S): A security-disabled global group was deleted.
segment.target: 4753(S): A security-disabled global group was deleted.

segment.source: 4759(S): A security-disabled universal group was created.
segment.target: 4759(S): A security-disabled universal group was created.

segment.source: See event “4749: A security-disabled global group was created.”
segment.target: See event “4749: A security-disabled global group was created.”

segment.source: Event 4759 is the same, but it is generated for a universal distribution group instead of a global distribution group.
segment.target: Event 4759 is the same, but it is generated for a universal distribution group instead of a global distribution group.

segment.source: All event fields, XML, and recommendations are the same.
segment.target: All event fields, XML, and recommendations are the same.

segment.source: The type of group is the only difference.
segment.target: The type of group is the only difference.
